meanings.sent1: The loud noise roosed the sleeping dog from its nap.
meanings.sent2: The motivational speech roosed the team to take action.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected challenge roosed laughter among the group.
meanings.sent4: Her passionate plea roosed a wave of emotions in the audience.
meanings.sent5: The thrilling music roosed excitement in the crowd.

meanings.definition: To rouse from sleep or inactivity
meanings.sent1: The alarm clock roosed him from his deep slumber.
meanings.sent2: The smell of breakfast roosed the family on a lazy Sunday morning.
meanings.sent3: The playful puppy roosed the children from their boredom.
meanings.sent4: The bright sunlight roosed the flowers to bloom in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The urgent phone call roosed her from her daydream.
